tn.text: Yahweh tells Ezekiel to speak to the people of Israel. He tells a story where the nation of Israel is a lioness and some of the past kings in the kingdom of Judah are her cubs.
Yahweh continues to describe the nation of Israel as a lioness and the kings of the kingdom of Judah as her cubs.

tn.ref: so she took another of her cubs
tn.text: Yahweh now compares Jehoiachin with a young lion cub. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: he raped their widows and ruined their cities
tn.text: These expressions are metonymy for God causing or allowing Israel's enemies to do these things. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh continues to describe the nation of Israel as a lioness and the kings of the kingdom of Judah as her cubs.
The word "him" refers to the second young lion, who represents Jehoiachin.
AT: "from the provinces surrounding the land of Israel." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
countries that were ruled by Babylon
Yahweh describes the nation of Israel as though it was the mother of the princes of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: a vine planted in your blood
tn.text: Possible meanings are that "blood" represents 1) the violence of the kings of Judah who had murdered people or 2) the plentiful wine of Judah which had become a symbol of prosperity. AT: "a vine planted by means of violence"  or "a vine planted in your prosperity" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
Yahweh continues to compare Israel with a vine and her leaders with the strong branches of the vine.
